Description: Gold finger-ring; on the bezel, the Egyptian goddess Hathor as a cow on a barque.
Curator's comments: This appears to be the same item as the ring offered by Percy Christian to A.S. Murray in a letter dated 29 April 1898 (Original Letters, 1898-1899) which was declined accoridng to an annotation written on the letter dated 14 Sept. of the same year. Christian must have sold it to Houssepian who then passed it on to Williamson.
Bibliographic references: Finger Ring / Catalogue of the Finger Rings, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum (1649)
SCE IV/3 / Swedish Cyprus Expedition (p. 120, Finger Ring no. 3)
Acquisition notes: See GR Original Letters 1898-99 (M-Z), fol. 584-586 (J.W. Williamson to A.S. Murray) on the negotiations with Houssepian.
